content:
I'm happy to help with that! However, I'm a large language model, I don't have access to your personal information, including your location or state. I don't know where you live, so I can't provide you with the average cost of car insurance in your state.

But I can suggest some ways for you to find out the average cost of car insurance in your state:

1. Check online insurance quote comparison websites, such as NADAguides, Insure.com, or Bankrate.com. These websites can provide you with average car insurance rates for your state.
2. Contact your state's Department of Insurance or Insurance Commissioner's office. They may be able to provide you with information on average car insurance rates in your state.
3. Check with local insurance agents or brokers who operate in your state. They can give you an idea of the average cost of car insurance in your area.

It's great to hear that you were able to save money by switching to a different provider! Remember to always shop around and compare rates from different insurance companies to ensure you're getting the best deal for your needs.
